intro: Atriplex vestita var. vestita, commonly known as sandmat, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of North America. It is characterized by its succulent, gray-green leaves that help reduce water loss in harsh environments. The plant produces small, greenish flowers arranged in clusters, which are typically wind-pollinated. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in desert scrub and coastal dunes. Atriplex vestita var. vestita is a hardy, drought-tolerant species that plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local wildlife.
